questions.question: Define civic virtue.

choices.answer: Good for the entire community, NOT just a few people.
Explains how a government is organized.
Government where rulers have unlimited, absolute power.
Putting others needs above your own, helping others.

questions.question: Define a constitution.

choices.answer: Good for everyone, NOT just a few people.
Government where rulers have absolute, unlimited power.
A set of rules that explains how a government is organized.
A government where power is held by the people .

questions.question: What are your natural rights?

choices.answer: Something you are born with, that can not be taken away.
A government in which the powers of the ruler are LIMITED.
A situation where there are no laws, no rules, no government
Putting others needs above your own, helping others.

questions.question: What is the common good?

choices.answer: A set of laws that explains how a government is ruled.
What is good for the entire community, NOT just a few people
a situation where there are no laws, no rules, no government
a government in which the powers of the ruler is LIMITED.

questions.question: Define a state of nature.

choices.answer: a government where power is held by the people
a government in which the rulers have absolute power
what is good for everyone, NOT just a few people
a situation where there is no laws, no rules, no government

questions.question: Define a constitutional government.

choices.answer: a government in which rulers have unlimited power
a government in which the power is held by the people
a government where the power of the ruler is LIMITED
a situation where there is no rules, no laws, no government

questions.question: What is a dictatorial government?

choices.answer: a government in which the powers of the rule is LIMITED
a government in which the rulers have unlimited power
a situation where there are no laws, no rules, no government
a government in which the power is held by the people

questions.question: Define a republican government.

choices.answer: a government in which the people have the power
a government in which the rulers have absolute power
a situation where there are no laws, no laws, no government
a set of rules that explains how a government is organized

questions.question: Choose the Founder from below.

choices.answer: King George
Paul Revere
John Locke
Donald Trump

questions.question: Who is NOT a Founder?

choices.answer: Abigail Adams

questions.question: Which of the below is NOT a natural right?

choices.answer: life
liberty
poverty
property

questions.question: What is the right to life?

choices.answer: the right to be free
the right to live without fear of being injured or killed
the right to own things
a state of nature

questions.question: What is the right to property?

choices.answer: the right to live without fear of being injured or killed
the right to own things
a state of nature
the right to be free

questions.question: What is the right to liberty?

choices.answer: the right to own things
the right to be free
the right to live without fear of being injured or killed
a state of nature

questions.question: In which document would you find, "For cutting off our Trade with all Parts of the World"?

choices.answer: Declaration of Independence
The United States Constitution

questions.question: In which document would you find, "He has kept among us, in Times of Peace, Standing Armies"?

choices.answer: Declaration of Independence
The US Constitution

questions.question: In which document would you find, "The Congress shall assemble at least once in every Year"?

choices.answer: Declaration of Independence
The US Constitution

questions.question: In which document would you find,"among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness"?

choices.answer: The Declaration of Independence
The US Constitution

questions.question: In which document would you find, "We the People"?

choices.answer: Declaration of Independence
The US Constitution

questions.question: In which document would you find, "The judicial power shall be vested in one Supreme Court"?

choices.answer: Declaration of Independence
The US Constitution
